pages.text: When you're out exploring, you'll need some way to keep track of where you are, where you've been, and how to get back home at the end of the day.$(2br)An $(item)antique atlas$() allows you to map out wherever you travel, and place $(thing)waypoints$() for important locations.

pages.title: Antique Atlas
pages.text: After crafting an $(item)atlas$(), $(thing)right-click$() it in your hand to activate it. You will then be able to see a $(thing)minimap$() in the $(thing)top-right$() corner and the item will be given a number, just like a normal vanilla map.

The fullscreen map can be opened by $(thing)right-clicking$() an active $(item)atlas$(). This view allows you to see everything held within the atlas, as well as place $(thing)waypoints$().$(2br)To place a $(thing)waypoint$(), click the top button on the right side of the map, then click again to place it on the map. You will then be prompted to set a name and icon.

To delete a $(thing)waypoint$(), select the second button, and click the $(thing)waypoint$() you wish to remove.$(2br)Clicking the third button will show or hide all of the $(thing)waypoints$(), which is useful when you only want to see the terrain.$(2br)Maps can also be $(thing)exported as an image$() by clicking the final button, where it will be saved to your $(thing)screenshots folder$().
